Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: Peppol: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Peppol: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: T0125/T6338, Despatch Advice Number/Order Receipt Number. Peppol: An transaction instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Dispatch advice issue date
Element.Description: BEAst: T6325, Document Date/Time. Peppol: The date when the despatch advice is issued. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: Dispatch advice issue time
Element.Description: BEAst: T6325, Document Date/Time. Peppol: The time when the despatch advice is issued. Format = "hh:mm:ss"

Element.Name: Dispatch note
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Transport Information (T6008). Peppol: A textual note for the dispatch as whole.

Element.Name: Order reference
Element.Description: BEAst: T3309/T6335, Order Number/Call Off Reference. Peppol: Used to provide a reference to the order on which the despatch is based.

Element.Name: Additional documents
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for additional BEAst information on header level. Peppol:

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: The reference number of the added information. Can be the Project Number (T6004), Customers' Reference (T6005), Seller's Order Number (T6099), Final Customer's Order Number (T6221), Drawing Number (T6222), Delivery Part (T6340), Freight Payer's Customer Number (T6463) or Document Name (T6484) depending on DocumentType. Peppol: An identifier for the referenced document.

Element.Name: Document description
Element.Description: BEAst: The type of reference when a valid code is not possible to use. "FreightPayersCustomerNumber" (T6463), "SellersOrderNumber" (T6099), "FinalCustomersOrderNumber" (T6221), "DeliveryPart" (T6340) or Any other document type (T6473). Peppol: Textual description of the document.

Element.Name: Attached document
Element.Description: BEAst: The referenced document can here be inserted as a binary object (T6475). Peppol: The attached document embeded as binary object, coded as Base64. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the document

Attribute.Name: Attached document Mime code
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The mime code of the attached document.

Attribute.Name: Attached document filename
Attribute.Description: BEAst: filename refers to T6476. Peppol: The file name of the attached document

Element.Name: External reference
Element.Description: Peppol: Reference to external document

Element.Name: External document URI
Element.Description: BEAst: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the external object as an Internet resource (T6187). Peppol: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

Element.Name: Despatching party information
Element.Description: BEAst: This party defines the company that provides the goods or the service. It also defines the sender of the Despatch Advice. The real Ship-from Address must be provided in the Despatch Address when the Despatch Advice describes a movement. Peppol: The Despatch Party is the person or organization who provides (despatch) the goods or services. The role is carried out by the supplier or on behalf of the supplier. (Despatch Party is sometimes known as the Consignor).

Element.Name: Despatch party electronic address
Element.Description: Peppol: Identifies the despatch party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: Scheme identifier for electronic address

Element.Name: Despatching party identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Shipper (T0129) Peppol: The identifier of the despatching party

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Peppol: Postal address of the depatching party

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Dispatching party name
Element.Description: BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the dispatching party

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: BEAst: Name (T5012) Peppol: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: BEAst: Phone Number (T5010) Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: BEAst: Email Address (T5011) Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: Consignee information
Element.Description: BEAst: This party defines the company that receives the goods or the service. It also defines the receiver of the Despatch Advice. Peppol: The Consignee is the person or organization to which the products will be shipped and who is taking possession. The role is carried out by the customer or on behalf of the customer.

Element.Name: Consignee party electronic address
Element.Description: Peppol: Identifies the consignee party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: Scheme identifier for electronic address

Element.Name: Consignee party identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Consignee (T0036) Peppol: The receiving party identifier.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Peppol: Postal address of the consignee

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Consignee party name
Element.Description: BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the receiving party.

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: BEAst: Name (T5012) Peppol: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: BEAst: Phone Number (T5010) Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: BEAst: Email address (T5011) Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: Buyer
Element.Description: Peppol: The buyer is the legal person or organization who buys or purchases the goods or services. The role is carried out by the customer or on behalf of the customer.

Element.Name: Buying party identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Buyer (T0008) Peppol: The buying party identifier

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Buying party name
Element.Description: BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the buying party

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Peppol: Postal address of the customer

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Seller
Element.Description: Peppol: The seller is the legal person or organization who sells goods or services to the customer. The role is carried out by the supplier or on behalf of the supplier.

Element.Name: Selling party identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Supplier (T0009) Peppol: An identifier for the seller party.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Selling party name
Element.Description: BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The seller party name.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Peppol: Postal address of the supplier

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Originator customer party
Element.Description: BEAst: For 3PL shipments, this party defines the final receiver of the goods. Peppol:

Element.Name: Originating party identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Ultimate Customer ID (T6001 or T6223). Peppol: The originator party identifier.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Originating party name
Element.Description: BEAst: Ultimate Customer name (T5001). Peppol: The originator party name.

Element.Name: Postal address
Element.Description: Peppol: Postal address of the originator

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: BEAst: Street Name (T5003). Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: BEAst: City name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: BEAst: Postal code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: BEAst: Country code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Shipment identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: T6127, Freight forwarder's referens number Peppol: Identifies a shipment.

Element.Name: Shipment description
Element.Description: BEAst: Used by BEAst for Supplier Remark (T6038). Peppol: Free-form text applying to a shipment. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.

Element.Name: Shipment gross weight
Element.Description: BEAst: Total Gross Weight (T6472) Peppol: The total weight of the shipment including packaging, as dispatched from the dispatching party.

Attribute.Name: Shipment quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the shipment quantity.

Element.Name: Shipment gross volume
Element.Description: BEAst: Total Gross Volume (T6494) Peppol: The total volume of the shipment including packaging, as dispatched from the dispatching party.

Attribute.Name: Shipment volume unit of measure
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the shipment volume.

Element.Name: Total number of transport handling units
Consignment identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Use a dummy value since this element is mandatory. Peppol: An association to Consignment covering the shipment. Unique number assigned to goods, both for import and export.

Element.Name: Vehicle description
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Vehicle identity number (T6100) Peppol: Description and/or identification of the vehicle that tranpsorts the despatched shipment.

Element.Name: Carrier party identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Carrier (T3208). Peppol: The carrier party identifier.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: It is recommended to use the schemeID. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Carrier name
Element.Description: BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the carrier that handles the delivery of the dispatched shipment.

Element.Name: Driver information
Element.Description: Peppol: Identification about the driver of the vehicle that delivers the despatched shipment.

Element.Name: Driver identification document type
Element.Description: Peppol: The type of document used for identifying the driver, expressed in text.

Element.Name: Mode of transport
Element.Description: BEAst: Transport mode (T6131). Peppol: The mode of transport with which the goods were delivered.

Element.Name: Delivery tracking identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Tracking URL (T6737) Peppol: Used to provide a tracking id for delvivery e.g. UPS or postal.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: BEAst: Unloading Date and Time (T6372)/Delivery Period Start Date (T6319) Peppol: The start date of the period

Element.Name: Period start time
Element.Description: BEAst: Unloading Date and Time (T6372)/Delivery Period Start Time (T6734) Peppol: The start time of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: BEAst: Delivery Period End Date (T6320) Peppol: The end date of the period.

Element.Name: Period end time
Element.Description: BEAst: Delivery Period End Time (T6735) Peppol: The end time of the period.

Element.Name: Shipment dispatch date
Element.Description: BEAst: Loading Date and Time (T6371)/Despatch Date and Time (T6242) Peppol: The actual or expected date when the shipment was dispatched from the dispatching party.

Element.Name: Shipment dispatch time
Element.Description: BEAst: Loading Date and Time (T6371)/Despatch Date and Time (T6242) Peppol: The actual or expected time when the shipment was dispatched from the dispatching party.

Element.Name: Despatch address
Element.Description: BEAst: The Despatch Address is used to define the Ship-from when the Despatch Supplier Party is not. When the Despatch Advice describes a movement, the Despatch Address should be included. Peppol:

Element.Name: Identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Identity of the Despatch Address (T0129).

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: BEAst: City Name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: BEAst: Postal Code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: BEAst: Country Code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Dispatch line identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Line Number (T0051) Peppol: A indentifier for the individual line in the despatch advice.

Element.Name: Dispatch line note
Element.Description: BEAst: Transportation Information (T6008) Peppol: General note regarding the despach advice line. Free-form text applying to the Despatch Line. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.
Element.Value: Mrs Green agreed to waive charge

Element.Name: Delivererd quantity
Element.Description: BEAst: Delivered Quantity (T0070)/Despatched Quantity (T0131). unitCode refers to T6706 Peppol: The quantity that is despatched in the line.

Attribute.Name: Ordered quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.

Element.Name: Outstanding quantity
Element.Description: BEAst: Backordered Quantity (T0059). unitCode refers to T6706 Peppol: The quantity outstanding (which will follow in a later shipment).

Attribute.Name: Ordered quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.

Element.Name: Outstanding quantity reason
Element.Description: BEAst: Change Reason Description (T6220) Peppol: The reason for the outstanding quantity.

Element.Name: Order line identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Calloff Line Reference (T6336)/Reference to Order Line (T3322) Peppol: To uniquely identify the line of the order that is being despatched.

Element.Name: Sales Order Line number.
Element.Description: BEAst: Reference to the sellers orderline number (T6462). Peppol: To uniquely identify the line of the sales order that is being despatched.

Element.Name: Order identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Order Number (T3309) Peppol: Identifies the order that the reference order line belongs to.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: ID of the referenced document or item: Reference to Delivery Note (T0063), Customer's Reference Number (T6005), Offer Number (T6010), Vendor's Order Number (T6099), Ultimate Customer's Order Number (T6221), Drawing Number (T6222), Material Ticket Number (T6329), Material Ticket Reference (T6337), Delivery Unit (T6340), Reference to Web (T6373), Ultimate Customer's Order Line Number (T6458), Offer Line Number (T6466) or Document Name (T6484). Peppol: An identifier for the referenced document.

Element.Name: Document description
Element.Description: BEAst: Identifies the type of document or item. ("ReferenceToDeliveryNote", "CustomersReferenceNumber", "OfferNumber", "EndCustomersOrderNumber", "DrawingNumber", "MaterialTicketNumber", "MaterialTicketReference", "DeliveryUnit", "ReferenceToWeb", "EndCustomersOrderLineNumber", "OfferLineNumber", any other type of document or item). Peppol: Textual description of the document.

Element.Name: Item name
Element.Description: BEAst: Article Description (T6226) Peppol: A short name for an item.

Element.Name: Buyers item identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Buyer's Part Article Number (T6022)/Article Number (T0172) when T6317="BP"/Littera (T6417). Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the buyer, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the buyer's system.

Element.Name: The Sellers item identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Supplier's Article Number (T0172) Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.

Element.Name: The sellers extended item identifier
Element.Description: Peppol: An extended identifier for the item that identifies the item with specific properties, e.g., Item 123 = Chair / Item 123 Ext 45 = brown chair.

Element.Name: Standard item identification
Element.Description: BEAst: Only one Standard Item Number can be used per line. Peppol:

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Global Trade Item Number (T0154) or RSK Article Number Sweden (T6023). All other item number standards used within BEAst can not be used here until the organisation behind the standard decides to be a part of the codelist "ISO 6523 ICD". These are: NOBB Article Number (T6027), RT Article Number (T6460), TUN Article Number (T6028), Finfo/Vilma Article Number (T6029), Norwegian RSK Article Number (T6024), Norwegian E-number (T6026), E-number (T0260) and SGTIN (T6461). Peppol: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.

Attribute.Name: Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier

Element.Name: Item standard extended identifier
Element.Description: Peppol: with specific properties, e.g., Item 123 = Chair / Item 123 Ext 45 = brown chair.

Element.Name: Item classification code
Element.Description: BEAst: Used to classify the material when the item number is not sufficient (T6466), to inform about the source of classification standard (T6467) and to provide standard branch codes for the items. The Reference to Article Class (T6466) is the ItemClassificationCode, listID = "ZZZ", listVersionID = BEAST:4.0" and name is Source to Classification (T6467). Peppol: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.

Attribute.Name: Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: BEAst: For Item Classification Codes that are found in UNCL7143, select the correct code and leave listVersionID and name empty. For construction specific list that are not a part of UNCL7143 yet ListID must always be "ZZZ" and listVersionID "BEAST:4.0", i.e. mutually agreed. Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier

Attribute.Name: Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier

Attribute.Name: Clear text name equivalent of classification code
Attribute.Description: BEAst: If construction specific lists are used, name specifies which of them is used. Possible names are: "SBMI", "SA", "AI", ME and "CoClass. "SBMI" = Sveriges Bergmaterialindustrier, "SA" = Sveriges kerifretag, "AI" = tervinningsindustrierna, ME = Maskinentreprenrerna. Peppol: The textual equivalent of the code value

Element.Name: Hazardous item UNDG code
Element.Description: BEAst: Dangerous Goods Code (T0169) Peppol: The identifier assigned to transportable hazardous goods by the United Nations, expressed as a code.

Element.Name: Haszardous hazard class Identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Dangerous Goods, Hazard Code (T0263) Peppol: Identifies a hazard class applicable to dangerous goods as defined by the relevant regulation authority, such as the IMDG Class Number of the SOLAS Convention ofIMO and the ADR/RID Class Number for the road/rail environment.

Element.Name: Additional item property information
Element.Description: BEAst: This group is also in BEAst used for ConfigurationValue (T6369), GUID Identifier (T6408), Treatment code (T6468), Alternative Vehicle Type (T6339), EPD data, NeC additional information about Asphalt and Concrete, Price information and Rental additional information. Peppol: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.

Element.Name: Item property name
Element.Description: BEAst: Product Group Code (T0011), Property Name (T6446), Product Type Description (T6442). When the NameCode is used, the name can be set to "NA" since it is mandatory to have. Peppol: The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

Element.Name: Item property code
Element.Description: BEAst: "ConfigurationValue", "GUIDIdentifier", "TreatmentCode", "AlternativeVehicleType", "EPDDataSetID", "EPDDataSetURL", "EPDPDFURL", "ResourceID", "Price" or "Rental". Property ID NeC (T6469), Property ID Type (T6443), Identity Type Code (T6440). listID refers to Property ID (T6444) but is always "BEAST:4.0" when NameCode is any of the fix values defined here. Peppol: Code for the item property according to a property code system.

Attribute.Name: Name code list id.
Attribute.Description: Peppol: An identifier for the code list used for the Name code, this is bilaterally agreed

Element.Name: Item property value
Element.Description: BEAst: Price Amount (T6235), Alternative Vehicle Type (T6339), Configuration Value (T6369), GUID Identifier (T6408), Property Class ID (T6441), Property Value (T6452), Treatment Code (T6468), EPD data, Resource ID, Rental Indicator (T6477) or Article Property (T6470). The Rental Indicator (T6477) is changed from "True"/"False" to "Rental"/"Purchase". Peppol: The value of the item property.

Element.Name: Item property unit of measure
Element.Description: BEAst: Property Compare Code (T6457), Price Unit Basis Quantity (T6722). unitCode refers to Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706). Peppol: The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.

Attribute.Name: Value quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity.

Element.Name: Property classification
Element.Description: BEAst: Property Value ID (T6450), Price Specification Code (T6721). Peppol: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.

Element.Name: Item manufactured date
Element.Description: BEAst: Production or Manufacture Date (T0262) Peppol: The manufacturing date of all items listed in this dispatch line.

Element.Name: Item best before date
Element.Description: BEAst: Best Before Date (T3276) Peppol: The best before date of all items listed in this dispatch line.

Element.Name: Item serial numbers
Element.Description: BEAst: Serial Number (T3236) Peppol: Serial numbers for items listed in the dispatch line.

Element.Name: Item batch number
Element.Description: BEAst: Batch Number (T0132). Peppol: The batch number that applies to all items in the dispatch line.

Element.Name: Item expiry date
Element.Description: Peppol: The expiry date of all items listed in this dispatch line.

Element.Name: Shipment identifier
Element.Description: Peppol: Element is mandated by syntax structure use value NA

Element.Name: Transport handling unit information
Element.Description: BEAst: This group is used when it is possible to describe the content of the Transport Handilng Units. Peppol:

Element.Name: Handling unit identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: The SSCC identification code of this Transport Handling Unit (T0138). Peppol: Identifies the transport handling unit.

Element.Name: Handling unit type
Element.Description: BEAst: Type of Transport Handling Unit (T6119). Use UN/ECE Recommendation 21 with addition of the codes used by "Retursystem Byggpall". Peppol: The type of packaging that represent the handling unit, such as box, pallet, container etx.

Element.Name: Handling unit hazardous indicator
Element.Description: Peppol: Indicates whether the shipment contains hazardous materials.

Element.Name: Handling unit shipping marks
Element.Description: Peppol: Free-form description of the marks and numbers on a transport unit or package.

Element.Name: Attribute identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: To describe the type of measurement (T6714). Use UNCL 6313 subset. Peppol: Code to indicate if the measure is gross weight or gross volume

Element.Name: Handling unit gross weight or handling unit gross volume
Element.Description: BEAst: For the measure (T6122) and Measure of Unit Code (T6706). Use UN/ECE Recommendation 20 and 21. subset. Peppol: Handling gross weight, including packaging as dispatched by dispatching party.Handling gross volume, including packaging as dispatched by dispatching party.

Attribute.Name: Handling unit gross weight or volume unit of measure
Attribute.Description: Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the handling unit gross weight or to the handling unit gross volume.

Element.Name: Package identifier
Element.Description: BEAst: Unique identity of the package (T0138). Peppol: An identifier for this package

Element.Name: Packaging type code
Element.Description: BEAst: Type of Package (T6119). Use UN/ECE Recommendation 21 with addition of the codes used by "Retursystem Byggpall". Peppol: The type of packaging used, such as box, pallet, container etx.
